thread.title: Rail commuters warned of rush hour delays | Meridian
thread.title_full: Rail commuters warned of rush hour delays | Meridian - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Rail commuters warned of rush hour delays | Meridian
text:
The problem has now been fixed but there will be 'residual delays' Credit: PA Commuters in the Thames Valley have been warned they will have to deal with disruption for several hours during the morning rush after a signalling problem on a busy railway line into London.
Passengers could be delayed by up to an hour as a result of a problem between Wimbledon and Earlsfield which sparked cancellations on services into and out of Waterloo.
The signalling problem between Wimbledon and Earlsfield has now been resolved and trains are now able to run to and from London Waterloo via Wimbledon.
However, we expect there will be knock-on disruption for several hours. Delays of up to 60 minutes to journeys are expected until services fully return to normal.
â€“ A spokesman for South West Trains Last updated Wed 2 Sep 2015 Read more 2 updates Commuter anger at rail delays into London Travel Surrey Sussex South West Trains London Waterloo Wimbledon
